tweets.text: Enjoyable visit to R. Chess today. Shocking to see road runoff #pollution but good discussions on planning a brighter future for #chalkstreams & the communities living alongside them. Britain's endemic Willow Tit subspecies P. montanus kleinschmidti headed for extinction. Alongside declines is ongoing disappearance from many former sites. In Doncaster / York area specifically an exacerbating factor is @envagency 's new policy of clearing all floodbank scrub. https://t.co/ngrCIRTGX3 https://t.co/F4MPR8G7dN

tweets.text: There's the potential for flooding from surface water and rivers over the next few days, it's really important to check your flood risk whether you are travelling at Christmas or staying put. #Flood warnings are a free service and updated every 15 minutes https://t.co/IjKDXeevvB https://t.co/pXVUvjf9vx

Allermoor Spillway stopped running early this morning, we had teams out first thing opening Monksleaze to operate the SOWY FRC at maximum capacity, this allows us to commence pumping at Langport stations until spillways start to run again. @EnvAgencySW https://t.co/IhBXnHPOu1

Across the #northwest there are currently;  
‚û°Ô∏è9 flood alerts and 
‚û°Ô∏è1 flood warning in place. 

Visit https://t.co/uGQ4g6A5Xn for the latest. 

#prepareactsurvive #floodalert #floodwarning #bepreparef

tweets.text: Environment Agency Wessex field teams out and about all weekend checking and operating our assets across the Somerset Levels and Moors. Flood duty teams monitoring river levels and rainfall totals. Pumps will operate when river levels allow. @EnvAgencySW @DavidHall_ @pow_rebecca https://t.co/jC0DC3AwpB

Caton Road, Lancaster (Phase 3) Flood Risk Management Scheme https://t.co/JgUy0kdOKw Drone shots show the scale of the task and how ¬£3.85 #ERDF has been spent. Great work by all involved @esif1420england @LancasterCC @EnvAgency @TheFloodHub #growthprogramme

The #BostonBarrier is the first @EnvAgency project which retrospectively looked at @GlobalGoalsUN. We can evidence achievements against all 17 #GlobalGoals & this work is now used as a benchmark within the EA for all future major projects.

üìΩÔ∏èWatch as @johncurtinEA explains more: https://t.co/4Kxnw84SZX

‚ö†Ô∏èFlood Alert‚ö†Ô∏è| As rain continues, the @EnvAgency expect the River Wye to peak Sat afternoon at the Old Wye Bridge & Greyfriars Avenue, Hereford. The level should not exceed the barriers. 
Please avoid driving through flood water & keep up to date: https://t.co/VvsaRfax6z https://t.co/k0AT6QpP5h

@UnaPaloma @nickcarey @MeridianWater @thameswater 4. A paid survey by a #watervole expert(&using data already collected by @StonebridgeLock #volunteers/ held by @LeeValleyPark)to draw up an inchannel #schedule9 #INNS management plan so that this can be sensitively reduced during watetvole breeding season April-Sep by #volunteers

tweets.text: Second gauging of the day for @EnvAgencySW . River Fowey@ Restormel. Approx 39 cumecs. One of the Crown Jewels of Devon and Cornwall gauges- there is a major abstraction supplying most of Cornwall‚Äôs drinking water, plus it lies upstream of Lostwithiel, so is key for #floodwarning https://t.co/fAH8040xcQ

The Met office have issued an amber warning for rain. We have issued flood alerts across the South West and are expecting to have to issue some flood warnings this afternoon. Please keep an eye on our flood warnings and know what to do in a flood https://t.co/QdPKdEYx15
We have issued a flood warning for the River Dart from Buckfastleigh to Totnes, including Staverton #Devon https://t.co/oamBdxjtoP https://t.co/JyjzIitrv9
